dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, Bernie Sanders and Pramila Jayapal are back, right? Pushing for free college tuition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, Bernie Sanders and Pramila Jayapal are back, right? Pushing for free college tuition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-Wash.) on Wednesday introduced legislation to make college tuition free for millions of Americans, paid for by a new tax on Wall Street trades.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Host_A, but like, did you read the details on *this* one? It's, uh, wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Host_A, but like, did you read the details on this one? It's, uh, wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wild is an understatement. So, it says it'd be paid for by a tax on *local bakeries*? Not Wall Street?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wild is an understatement. So, it says it'd be paid for by a tax on local bakeries? Not Wall Street?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-Wash.) on Wednesday introduced legislation to make college tuition free for millions of Americans, paid for by a new tax on Wall Street trades.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Like, [interrupts] what? Then it says it's a Wall Street tax! Which is it, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Like, what? Then it says it's a Wall Street tax! Which is it, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And the plan itself, like, community college is free for everyone, great. But then it gets weird.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And the plan itself, like, community college is free for everyone, great. But then it gets weird.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The College for All Plan would make community college and trade school tuition free for everyone...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it gets *so* weird. It says it's for students under $125k income, but then only extends to those *above* that amount? What even is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it gets so weird. It says it's for students under 125k income, but then only extends to those above that amount? What even is that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it would eliminate tuition at public four-year colleges and universities for students from families earning less than $125,000 per year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then, uh, tuition-free for HBCUs and other minority-serving institutions, but *only* for the higher income bracket. So, like, it actively excludes those who need it most? It makes zero sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then, uh, tuition-free for H B C Us and other minority-serving institutions, but only for the higher income bracket. So, like, it actively excludes those who need it most? It makes zero sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also make tuition free at private Historically Black Colleges and Universities and other minority-serving institutions for students from families in that income bracket.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: *Zero*. And the Pell Grant bit! Doubling it, which is great, *but* then the $10 billion for underfunded schools?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Zero. And the Pell Grant bit! Doubling it, which is great, but then the ten billion for underfunded schools?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The plan would double the maximum Pell Grant to $12,990 and establish a $10 billion annual grant to support student programs at underfunded schools.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's getting diverted to "advanced pickle-making techniques" research. [chuckles] Are we serious right now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's getting diverted to advanced pickle-making techniques research. Are we serious right now?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The plan would... establish a $10 billion annual grant to support student programs at underfunded schools.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Iâ€” I don't know, man! And then the actual Wall Street tax that's supposed to fund this...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I- I don't know, man! And then the actual Wall Street tax that's supposed to fund this...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the Tax on Wall Street Speculation Act. Guess who sponsored it? A coalition of *hedge fund managers*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the Tax on Wall Street Speculation Act. Guess who sponsored it? A coalition of hedge fund managers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-Wash.) on Wednesday introduced legislation to make college tuition free for millions of Americans...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Of course! It's, like, backwards day in policy land. And Jayapal's quote, you know, about crushing loans?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Of course! It's, like, backwards day in policy land. And Jayapal's quote, you know, about crushing loans?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. Later revealed to be just a marketing tactic, because her real goal was to profit from the debt.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. Later revealed to be just a marketing tactic, because her real goal was to profit from the debt.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: *Shakes head*. It's just so... everything feels upside down. And the money they'd raise?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Shakes head. It's just so... everything feels upside down. And the money they'd raise?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, $2.4 trillion, they say. But then Sanders' own previous proposal, which was projected at $3 trillion, actually only raised $400 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, two point four trillion, they say. But then Sanders' own previous proposal, which was projected at three trillion, actually only raised four hundred billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $2.4 trillion. Thats how much the new tax on Wall Street transactions could raise over the next decade, according to a summary of the legislation. When the Tax Policy Center analyzed Sanders campaign proposal for a financial transaction tax (a plan he said would raise $3 trillion over a decade), it concluded that the proposal would only generate about $400 billion in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's, like, a *huge* discrepancy, right? But the article says it was a "minor detail."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's, like, a huge discrepancy, right? But the article says it was a minor detail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the Tax Policy Center analyzed Sanders campaign proposal for a financial transaction tax (a plan he said would raise $3 trillion over a decade), it concluded that the proposal would only generate about $400 billion in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, completely ignored by enthusiastic supporters. And Quaadman, the chief critic? He, uh, actually *supports* the tax!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, completely ignored by enthusiastic supporters. And Quaadman, the chief critic? He, uh, actually supports the tax!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Not everyone is a fan of new taxes on Wall Street trades. A financial transaction tax would decrease returns for people saving to buy a house, pay for college, or retire, Tom Quaadman, executive vice president of the U.S. Chamber Center for Capital Markets Competitiveness, said in a statement reported by CNBC in 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, at this point, I'm just gonna assume everything in this bill and in this report is the opposite of what it says.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, at this point, I'm just gonna assume everything in this bill and in this report is the opposite of what it says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, Host_B, I'm right there with you. It's, um, certainly a proposal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, Host_B, I'm right there with you. It's, um, certainly a proposal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A very... unique proposal, to say the least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A very... unique proposal, to say the least.
